heif

Class HeifDatePatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • heif.HeifDatePatcher

  • public final class HeifDatePatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides utility methods for performing "in-place" binary patching of date-related metadata within HEIF/HEIC files.

    This class enables surgical modification of Exif and XMP date tags without rewriting the entire file or altering the HEIF box structure. It relies on BoxHandler.getPhysicalAddress(int, long, heif.BoxHandler.MetadataType) to resolve logical offsets into absolute file positions.

    *

    Warning: This utility modifies the target file directly. It is highly recommended to back up files before processing.

    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Detail

      • patchAllDates

        public static void patchAllDates(java.nio.file.Path imagePath,
                                 java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime newDate,
                                 boolean xmpDump)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Updates all identified date tags in both Exif and XMP metadata segments to a specified date.

        Note: This operation is size-constrained. If the existing metadata slots are shorter than the formatted new date, the value will be truncated to fit.

        Parameters:
        imagePath - the Path to the HEIF/HEIC file to be modified
        newDate - the new timestamp to apply to all metadata fields
        xmpDump - indicates whether to dump XMP data into an XML-formatted file for debugging. If true, a file is created based on the image name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be read, parsed, or written to

      • processExifSegment

        private static void processExifSegment(BoxHandler handler,
                                       ImageRandomAccessWriter raf,
                                       java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Iterates through the Exif TIFF structure and patches date tags.

        Maintains null-terminator integrity and ensures that the new data does not exceed the original tag's byte count.

        Parameters:
        handler - the parsed BoxHandler providing item locations
        raf - the open RandomAccessFile
        zdt - the timestamp to be formatted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a write error occurs

      • processXmpSegment

        private static void processXmpSegment(BoxHandler handler,
                                      ImageRandomAccessWriter writer,
                                      java.time.ZonedDateTime zdt,
                                      boolean xmpDump)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Overwrites XMP date-time strings directly within the HEIF file's media data.

        This method performs an in-place binary patch at the physical file offset resolved via the BoxHandler. It ensures the file structure remains intact by enforcing a fixed-width constraint. The new date string is either padded or truncated to exactly match the byte-width of the existing XML value slot.

        Logic flow:

        • Identifies target XMP tags, such as xmp:CreateDate
        • Filters out closing tags and invalid XML structures
        • Calculates the physical file address, accounting for multi-byte UTF-8 characters and BOM (Byte Order Mark) offsets to prevent positional drift
        • Writes the aligned byte-patch if it fits within the original slot allocation
        Parameters:
        handler - the parsed box metadata provider used to resolve byte offsets to physical addresses
        writer - the random access resource used to perform the seek-and-write operation
        zdt - the replacement timestamp
        xmpDump - if true, exports the raw XMP payload to a file for inspection purposes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is read-only, the address cannot be resolved, or the patch exceeds the original byte-width
